senses.ex: She's always busy with her schoolwork.

Tips.title: Personal Priority
Tips.description: Used to express that someone is focused on their personal tasks or goals.
Tips.example: She's too busy to meet up; she's preparing for her exams.

Tips.title: Not Always Negative
Tips.description: 'Busy' can be neutral or positive, describing a fulfilling life.
Tips.example: He has a busy, happy life volunteering and traveling.

senses.ex: The market is always busy on Saturdays.

Tips.title: Energetic Atmosphere
Tips.description: Describes places with lots of people or things happening.
Tips.example: The festival was busy with music, dance, and food stalls.

Tips.title: Potential Overwhelm
Tips.description: Can imply feeling overwhelmed by too much activity.
Tips.example: The busy airport made her feel anxious.

senses.ex: Her dress was a bit too busy for my taste.

Tips.title: Visually Overwhelming
Tips.description: Refers to visual designs that draw a lot of attention, sometimes too much.
Tips.example: His shirt had such a busy pattern, it made my eyes hurt.

Tips.title: Subjective Taste
Tips.description: What is 'busy' for one may not be for another; it's a matter of personal taste.
Tips.example: Some may find this artwork busy, but I find it fascinating.

senses.de: Unable to talk or do other things because you are doing something
senses.ex: I'm a little busy right now, can we chat later?

Tips.title: Temporary State
Tips.description: Indicates a temporary state of being occupied.
Tips.example: He's busy now but will call you once he's finished.

Tips.title: Excuse for Delay
Tips.description: Often used as a polite excuse for not doing something right away.
Tips.example: I'm busy at the moment, can I get back to you later?

senses.de: To make someone have a lot to do
senses.ex: The project kept me busy for a few months.

Tips.title: Emotional Satisfaction
Tips.description: Being busy can relate to personal fulfillment in doing tasks.
Tips.example: Painting landscapes busies me and calms my mind.

Tips.title: Avoiding Boredom
Tips.description: Being busy is a way to prevent feeling bored or idle.
Tips.example: Stay busy on the trip by reading or playing games.

Active.wordDefinition:
The words active and busy both describe a state of being engaged in activity, but they differ in their connotations.

Active implies being involved in meaningful or intentional activity, such as playing a sport or actively engaging in a conversation.

Active suggests purposeful engagement in meaningful tasks or activities, while busy suggests being occupied with a lot of tasks or responsibilities, regardless of their purpose or value.

Bustle.wordDefinition:
Bustle means to move around quickly and noisily, often with a sense of purpose or urgency.

Essentially, bustle implies movement and noise, while busy implies productivity and occupation.

Engage.wordDefinition:
Engage means actively participating in something, showing interest or involvement, or making a commitment to a task or activity.

For example, a person can engage in a conversation, engage in sports or outdoor activities, or engage in volunteer work.

Busy refers to the quantity of activities or tasks a person has, while engage refers to the quality of involvement and commitment in a particular task or activity.

Frantic.wordDefinition:
Frantic means a state of wild excitement or confusion, usually accompanied by a sense of urgency or panic.

However, if the homework is due the next day and the person has not started yet, they might become frantic as they rush to finish it on time.

Busy refers to being occupied while frantic refers to a state of urgency and panic.

Hectic.wordDefinition:
Busy means having a lot of things to do, but still being in control and having enough time to complete them. Whereas, hectic means having a lot of things to do, but feeling overwhelmed and stressed, with not enough time to complete them all.

Hectic describes a situation where there is chaos, confusion and high levels of stress due to excessive work. For example, a student might be busy with school assignments but still have time for extracurricular activities, while a CEO might have a hectic schedule with multiple meetings and deadlines to meet.

Occupy.wordDefinition:
Busy means having a lot of things to do or being actively engaged in activities. It describes a state of being occupied with different tasks or responsibilities without necessarily specifying what those tasks are.

Occupy means to be actively using or residing in a specific space or location. It is a more specific term than busy as it refers to a particular place or thing.

For example, a group of protesters occupies a public park to demand government action on a certain issue.

Busy refers to a state of being engaged in activities, while occupy refers to being actively present in a certain place or space.

Productive.wordDefinition:
Busy means having a lot to do or being occupied with tasks, while productive means doing things that actually achieve something or have a tangible outcome.

A person who spends a few focused hours on a project and completes a task or milestone could be considered productive, even if they appear to have less overall activity.

Rush.wordDefinition:
Rush refers to moving quickly in order to complete a task or arrive at a destination on time. For example, someone might rush to catch a train or get to an appointment on time.

Busy refers to having a lot on one's plate, while rush refers to moving quickly to complete a specific task or meet a specific deadline.

quotes.Text: Music is a way of expressing my mood, and it definitely helps to motivate me before a game. It also helps me move on from past defeats or keeps my mind busy when I'm not playing, so music is definitely something that follows me every step of every day.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Sergio Ramos

quotes.Text: I try to keep it real. I don't have time to worry about what I'm projecting to the world. I'm just busy being myself.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Demi Lovato

quotes.Text: I like to go for a walk or swimming or in the garden when I can. It's a busy kind of life, but I guess I'm lucky.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Brian May

quotes.Text: I have a very busy life, and not many people who have a career and four kids go out a lot to the movies.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Meryl Streep

quotes.Text: I don't care how busy I am - I will always make time for what's most important to me.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Hart

quotes.Text: Painting's not important. The important thing is keeping busy.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Grandma Moses

quotes.Text: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: John Lennon

quotes.Text: You can really only enjoy life when you're extremely busy.
quotes.Title: French Actress
quotes.Name: Josephine de La Baume

quotes.Text: In every death, a busy world comes to an end.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mason Cooley

quotes.Text: I have a very busy personality.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Daniel Radcliffe
